text: Itzhak Ilan or Yitzhak Ilan ( July 28, 1956 – October 16, 2020) was a Georgian-born Israeli security official. He worked for the Israel Security Agency.Knesset debates whether Gaza disengagement helped Hamas, By Mazal Mualem, Published: 18.07.2014,Al-MonitorFormer Deputy Director of the Israeli Security Agency (“Shin-Bet”) joins Brainwave Science’s International Advisory Board, Business Wire, 16 February 2016 From 2010 to 2011, he was Deputy Director of the Shin Bet. Ilan was born in Surami, Georgia. Ilan died of COVID-19 on October 16, 2020 in Tel Aviv at the age of 64.Former Shin Bet deputy chief who led fight on West Bank terror dies of COVID-19 ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Israel Category:Israeli intelligence people Category:Israeli Jews Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:Politicians from Georgia (country) Category:Soviet Jews
title: Itzhak Ilan
